page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF FERNESS
page.content: The village of Ferness is included in our grid. It lies by the crossroads of the Nairn to Grantown and Forres to Carrbridge roads ( A & B roads respectively.) It is a rural community having approx. 10 houses, a garage and sub post office in the immediate area but with many small farms and a small number of houses nearby. The principal part of the grid consists of grouse moor with several large patches of forest situated nearer to the roads. The River Findhorn cuts through one corner flowing north on its way to the Moray Firth. The lowest point on the grid is by the river - 125m. The village lies at about 200m and the highest point is 275m on the grouse moor.
